name: (1E)-N,N'-bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3193
Reason: 1E-N,N'-bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide has a melting point that we will predict by analyzing its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is ethanimidamide, which has a melting point of 106°C. The presence of two phenyl groups (one at the amino group and one at the ethanimidamide base) increases the melting point due to the enhancement of π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. Additionally, the amino group can participate in hydrogen bonding, which may raise the melting point by approximately +10°C. The methyl groups on the phenyl rings may lower the melting point by approximately -5°C due to their reduced molecular weight and volume.
